remixlab.proscene
Class MouseGrabber

java.lang.Object
  remixlab.proscene.MouseGrabber
All Implemented Interfaces:
MouseGrabbable
public class MouseGrabber
extends java.lang.Object
implements MouseGrabbable

Base class for mouse grabbers objects that implements the MouseGrabbable interface.

If you want to implement your own MouseGrabber objects you should derive from this class (instead of implementing the MouseGrabbable interface), and implement the checkIfGrabsMouse(int, int, Camera) method and some of the provided callback methods, such mouseClicked(Scene.Button, int, Camera) and/or mouseWheelMoved(int, Camera).

Note: The InteractiveFrame object implements the MouseGrabbable interface.

mousePressed

public void mousePressed(Point eventPoint,
                         Camera camera)
Callback method called when the MouseGrabber grabsMouse() and a mouse button is pressed. Once a mouse grabber grabs the mouse and the mouse is pressed the default implementation will return that the mouse grabber keepsGrabbingMouse even if the mouse grabber loses focus.

The previous behavior is useful when you are planning to implement a mouse pressed event followed by mouse released event, e.g.,

The body of your mousePressed(Point pnt, Camera cam) method should look like:
super.mousePressed(pnt, cam); //sets the class variable keepsGrabbingMouse to true
myMousePressedImplementation;
...

The body of your mouseReleased(Point pnt, Camera cam) method should look like:
super.mouseReleased(pnt, cam); //sets the class variable keepsGrabbingMouse to false
myMouseReleasedImplementation;
...

Finally, the body of your checkIfGrabsMouse(int x, int y, Camera camera) method should look like:
setGrabsMouse( keepsGrabbingMouse || myCheckCondition); //note the use of the class variable keepsGrabbingMouse
...

Specified by:
mousePressed in interface MouseGrabbable
See Also:
mouseReleased(Point, Camera)

                          Camera camera)
